Generation VII.Sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
Generation VII.Moon: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It loves playing in the mud. If it isn't showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.

Generation VIII.Sword: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It's skilled at making use of mud.
Generation VIII.Shield: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won’t dry out even if it’s exposed to the sun for a long time.
Generation IX.Violet: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn't change even when it's loaded with 50 times its own body weight.

Generation VII.Sun: Routes 4 , 6 , and 12 , Paniola Ranch , Blush Mountain
Generation VII.Moon: Routes 4 , 6 , and 12 , Paniola Ranch , Blush Mountain
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Routes 4 , 6 , and 12 , Paniola Ranch , Blush Mountain
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Routes 4 , 6 , and 12 , Paniola Ranch , Blush Mountain

Generation VIII.Shield: Route 3 , Rolling Fields , Dappled Grove , West Lake Axewell , East Lake Axewell , North Lake Miloch , South Lake Miloch , Giant's Seat , Giant's Cap Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )
